Upgrade manually

Upgrade your AbanteCart eCommerce application core version once in a while, since important fixes or new features will be released.

Upgrade manually

If there is a new version available for your AbanteCart, you will have a notification in your message box of AbanteCart administration.

Before upgrade

Recommended that you DO NOT upgrade AbanteCart on live site. Depending on your server or OS configuration upgrades might not go all the way through and you will need more time for manual upgrade. We suggest you upgrade your test site first and always create backups.
Upgrades are available only from prior version to next. If you do not upgrade for long time, you will need to run all upgrades in between.
If you are made Core modifications in any of the files that changed, they may need to be redone.

  • 1

    Download upgrade package

    Download upgrade package from Google Drive or for older versions http://sourceforge.net/projects/abantecart/files/ and http://code.google.com/p/abantecart/downloads/list.
  • 2

    Backup AbanteCart

    Back up AbanteCart database and code

    There are several backup approach: The Backup Wizard interface in your hosting CPanel, AbanteCart buit-in backup, Manually backup all AbanteCart files and MySQL Database via phpMyAdmin.

  • 3

    Decompress the upgrade package

    Open archive and copy all contents of "code" directory to your AbanteCart directory. You need to override directories and files if your copy process request confirmation.
    AbanteCart file hierarchy - if you see this files you are in right place
    • Expand all
    • Collapse all
    • admin - Admin panel files
      • controller -
      • index.php -
      • ... -
    • core
    • download
    • extensions - All AbanteCart extensions are located in this folder.
    • image
    • install - folder should be removed when AbanteCart is installed.
      • abantecart_database.sql
      • ...
    • index.php - do not edit or add to this file.
    • license.txt - a software license
    • php.ini - file is where you declare changes to your PHP settings.
    • resources - resource library media files
    • robots.txt - is a text file to instruct search engine robots how to crawl and index pages on their website.
    • static_pages
    • storefront - storefront template files
    • system
    • task.php
    • ...
  • 4

    Change MySQL database tables prefix

    Open upgrade.sql file in text editor and replace beginning of table names (prefix) "ac_" with your tables prefix selected at original installation. Easiest way to replace all "ac_" instances with your table prefix via your text editor's Find&Replace tool. To check prefix, you can open your database and check beginning of all AbanteCart tables. If you did not use prefix, replace with empty.
  • 5

    Run modified upgrade.sql

    Finally run modified upgrade.sql file in MySQL (command line, phpMyAdmin or other )

Related pages:
